se.cbb.jprime.io

Class NewickTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.io.NewickTree
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrIMENewickTree

    public class NewickTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds a "pure" Newick tree. Essentially, this only consists of a tree rooted at a NewickNode, but with tree-specific meta info added, as well as some convenience methods. See NewickNode for more details, and PrIMENewickTree for an extension.

    One may invoke renumber() to renumber a tree post-order (Newick-style), starting with 0 at the first leaf. Be advised that this property may not always hold, e.g. if the tree numbers have been overridden by processed meta tags.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NewickTree

        public NewickTree(NewickVertex root,
          java.lang.String meta,
          boolean doRenumber,
          boolean doSort)
           throws NewickIOException
        Creates a Newick tree from a topology rooted at a NewickVertex. If chosen to be sorted, this occurs prior to numbering.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the topology, must not be null.
        meta - the meta info (provided between brackets) for the tree itself (vertices have their own meta tags).
        doRenumber - true to relabel the NewickNodes post-order (Newick-style).
        doSort - true to sort the tree using method sort(). Do not use when there are non-unique vertex names (e.g. bootstrap value names).
        Throws:
        NewickIOException.
        NewickIOException

      • NewickTree

        public NewickTree(NewickTree tree)
        Copy constructor. Perform a deep copy of a whole NewickTree.
        Parameters:
        tree - NewickTree to copy.

      • setMeta

        public void setMeta(java.lang.String meta)
        Sets the meta info for the tree itself. Null is recommended over empty string if lacking such info.
        Parameters:
        meta - the meta info.

      • renumber

        public void renumber()
        Relabels the node numbers of the tree Newick-style, i.e. post-order, starting with 0 at the first leaf.

      • hasMeta

        public boolean hasMeta()
        Returns true if meta info is not null (only referring to the tag of the tree itself, not its vertices). Empty string returns true, as does empty string enclosed in brackets.
        Returns:
        true if vertex has meta info.

      • isBifurcating

        public boolean isBifurcating()
        Returns true if the tree is strictly bifurcating, i.e. every vertex has 2 or 0 children.
        Returns:
        true if the tree is bifurcating.

      • isCollapsable

        public boolean isCollapsable()
        Returns true if the tree has a vertex with a single child.
        Returns:

      • getVerticesAsList

        public java.util.List<NewickVertex> getVerticesAsList()
        Returns all vertices as an array. Moreover, the array is sorted post-order style, i.e. it preserves the partial order of the tree in that for a vertex at index k, its ancestors have index k. This implies that the first element is the root, whereas the last element is a leaf.
        Returns:
        all vertices.

      • getLeavesAsList

        public java.util.List<NewickVertex> getLeavesAsList()
        Returns all leaves as a list.
        Returns:
        all vertices.

      • sort

        public void sort()
          throws NewickIOException
        Sorts the tree according to vertex names. See sort() of class NewickVertex for more details on how this is achieved. Assumes that vertex names are unique.
        Throws:
        NewickIOException - if name collision while sorting.

      • getVertexNames

        public java.lang.String[] getVertexNames(boolean leafNamesOnly)
        Returns the vertex names. Single uninitialised items are set to null. See also getVertexNamesMap().
        Parameters:
        leafNamesOnly - true to set array's interior vertex names to null.
        Returns:
        the names.

      • getBranchLengths

        public double[] getBranchLengths()
        Returns the branch lengths. If these are lacking altogether, null is returned. Single uninitialised items are set to NaN (for which one checks by Double.isNaN(val)). See also getBranchLengthsMap().
        Returns:
        the branch lengths.

      • getVertexNamesMap

        public NamesMap getVertexNamesMap(boolean leafNamesOnly,
                         java.lang.String name)
        Returns a map of the names indexed by vertex numbers.
        Parameters:
        leafNamesOnly - true to set map's interior vertex names to null.
        name - the name of the map.
        Returns:
        the map.

      • getBranchLengthsMap

        public DoubleMap getBranchLengthsMap(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a map of the branch lengths indexed by vertex numbers. If branch lengths are lacking altogether, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the map.
        Returns:
        the map.
